title: Japan a victim of corruption in Sri Lanka : Ambassador
byline: Japanese Ambassador Akio Isomata said that Japan was a victim of corruption in Sri Lanka , and expressed optimism that the government would tackle the issue.

title: All transport services to come under the state?
byline: The Government is to take steps towards declaring three wheelers, school vans, and office transport vehicles as transportation services that can be operated as interprovincial modes of transport as per the National Transport Commission (Amendment) Bill which was presented to Parliament last week.

title: Opposition parties in closed door talks to capture CMC
byline: The leaders of the opposition parties including former President Ranil Wickremesinghe and Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) National Organizer Namal Rajapaksa have started talks to work out an understanding to capture the power of the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC), a political source.

title: Technical fault or reckless driving cause 22 lives?
byline: Police investigations are underway to determine whether driver negligence or a technical malfunction caused the deadly bus accident in Kotmale, which claimed the lives of 22 people and injured at least 35 others.

title: US says it has a deal with China while Chinese call it ’consensus’
byline: In a media briefing after a second day of talks with U.S. negotiators on Sunday, Chinese Vice Premier He Lifeng said trade talks with the U.S. “achieved substantial progress and reached important consensus.”

title: US and China agree to drastically roll back tariffs
byline: The United States and China agreed Monday to drastically roll back tariffs on each other’s goods for an initial 90-day period, in a surprise breakthrough that has buoyed global markets.

title: Four-hour strike at Colombo port causes Rs. 300 million loss
byline: A four-hour strike by employees at the Jaya Container Terminal (JCT) and the East Container Terminal of the Colombo Port last night has resulted in an estimated loss of at least Rs. 300 million, a senior official of the Sri Lanka Ports Authority (SLPA) said.

title: Virat Kohli announces retirement from Test cricket
byline: India’s batting talisman Virat Kohli on Monday announced his retirement from Test cricket ending the speculation about his future in the longest format.

title: Over 8,000 ‘Dansals’ registered, PHIs urge for eco-friendly practices
byline: A total of 8,742 ‘Dansal’ stalls have been officially registered across Sri Lanka in celebration of Vesak, according to the Public Health Inspectors’ (PHI) Union.

title: Mother's sacrifice saves baby in Garandiella bus accident
byline: In a tragic bus accident in Kotmale’s Garandiella area, a mother’s final act of bravery and selfless sacrifice saved the life of her 9-month-old daughter.

title: US says it has a deal with China while Chinese call it ’consensus’
byline: In a media briefing after a second day of talks with U.S. negotiators on Sunday, Chinese Vice Premier He Lifeng said trade talks with the U.S. “achieved substantial progress and reached important consensus.”

title: Prime Minister Harini visits survivors of fatal Kotmale bus crash
byline: Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya and Transport Minister Bimal Ratnayake visited patients at Gampola and Peradeniya hospitals following the deadly bus crash at Gerandi Ella in Kotmale which claimed 21 lives and injured at least 35.

title: President pardons 388 inmates for Vesak Poya
byline: The Department of Prisons today released 388 inmates from countrywide prisons on a special pardon granted by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake in line with the Vesak Full Moon Poya Day.

title: Trump plans to accept luxury 747 from Qatar to use as Air Force One
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump’s administration intends to accept a Boeing (BA.N), opens new tab 747-8 airplane as a gift from the Qatari royal family that would be outfitted to serve as Air Force One, according to a source briefed on the matter.

title: Development in Indian Ocean region and  dealing with terrorism should continue simultaneously: RW
byline: The economic development in the Indian Ocean  region and dealing with terrorism should continue simultaneously, former President Ranil Wickremesinghe said.

title: Athapaththu fined for breaching ICC Code of Conduct
byline: Sri Lanka captain Chamari Athapaththu has been fined 10 per cent of her match fee for breaching Level 1 of the ICC Code of Conduct during the Women’s Tri-series match against South Africa in Colombo on Friday.

title: 'Give Kohli one more Test match to be sure he doesn’t belong in here'
byline: Virat Kohli on Monday (12) confirmed that he is retiring from Test cricket after speculation of days. Following the retirement of his teammate Rohit Sharma last week, it was reported by Indian media that their other batting sensation was considering the possibility of hanging his boot at least from the longest format of cricket.

title: Terry Brunk, Professional Wrestler and ‘Hardcore’ Pioneer Known as Sabu, Dies
byline: Terry Brunk, a professional wrestler known to fans as Sabu who pioneered the so-called hardcore style that became a touchstone of wrestling in the 1990s and 2000s, has died, World Wrestling Entertainment said. He was 60.

title: NPP’s 30% electricity tariff reduction promise by cutting corruption is blatant lie: Harsha
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Dr. Harsha De Silva said the National People’s Power’s (NPP) 30% tariff reduction promise by cutting corruption was a blatant lie and claimed that the main cause for the Ceylon Eelectricity Board (CEB) losses is the below cost tariff.

title: Inmate drowns in Mahaweli Ganga during Pallekele prison escape
byline: An inmate held at the Pallekele Open Air Prison has drowned while attempting to escape from custody, police said.

title: Bimal Ratnayake calls for high alert at ports, airports over Indo-Pak crisis
byline: Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation Minister Bimal Ratnayake underlined the critical need for Sri Lanka’s ports and airports to operate at peak efficiency in light of the escalating geopolitical tensions in the region.

title: Sri Pada pilgrim season ends today
byline: The annual Sri Pada pilgrimage season ends today with the Vesak Full Moon Poya Day, following the fulfillment of religious observances.

title: Avoid dansals if you’re unwell: PHI union
byline: The Public Health Inspectors’ (PHI) Union has requested individuals with infectious diseases to refrain from organising or attending Dansal events.

title: Excise gains record revenue of Rs. 83 billion in first four months
byline: A record gain of revenue amounting to over Rs. 83 billion has been achieved by the Department of Excise during the first four months of this year, even surpassing the stipulated target for the period by Rs. 3 billion.

title: Organised gang smuggles largest cigarette consignment in recent past
byline: A four-member gang of organised local male passengers, who tried to smuggle in what is considered to be the largest cigarette consignment in the recent past, through the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) was taken into custody by Sri Lanka Customs last night.

title: Warm weather advisory issued for several districts
byline: A Warm weather advisory has been issued for some places in the Ampara, Batticaloa, Polonnaruwa and Moneragala districts valid for tomorrow.

title: Police warn of rapidly spreading data dansala targeting Vesak
byline: A scam is currently circulating at high speed, falsely claiming to offer internet facilities and 50 GB of mobile data under the names of various leading telecommunications companies, police said.

title: Chess banned in Afghanistan; Taliban cities religious concerns
byline: In a move that has sparked international criticism but little surprise, the Taliban has officially suspended the sport of chess in Afghanistan, citing concerns over gambling and religious alignment.

title: Despite protests, ‘Tamil genocide monument’ inaugurated in Canada
byline: A controversial monument, described by organizers as commemorating Tamil civilians killed in the final stages of Sri Lanka’s civil war, was unveiled on Saturday at Chinguacousy Park in Brampton, Canada - despite repeated prior objections from the Sri Lankan government.

title: India will not tolerate any nuclear blackmail: Modi
byline: Asserting that India will not tolerate any “nuclear blackmail”, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday said that operations against Pakistan have only been kept in abeyance and the future will depend on their behaviour.

title: Sri Lanka Customs makes Rs. 430 Mn worth largest BIA Kush detection ever
byline: The Sri Lanka Customs this evening thwarted an attempt by a female British national to enter the country with a massive Rs. 460 million worth of Kush consignment, thus making it the largest detection of the Cannabis variety in the airport history.

title: Dayasiri proposes Opposition parties to form non-party councils
byline: SJB MP Dayasiri Jayasekara said today that all Opposition parties and independent groups must unite to form councils in local bodies where the Opposition commands a majority as non-party councils.
